title: Paint surfaces - Data analysis with arrays FRQ

content.description:
The  Surface  class is used to store information about a flat rectangular surface. A partial declaration of the  Surface  class is shown.
 public class Surface 
{
 /**
 * Returns the width of the surface, in feet
 */
 public double getWidth() 
 { /* implementation not shown */ }

/**
 * Returns the length of the surface, in feet
 */
 public double getLength() 
 { /* implementation not shown */ }

/* There may be instance variables, constructors,
 and methods that are not shown. */
}

The  Painter  class maintains an array of surfaces that need to be painted.
 public class Painter 
{
 /** The array of surfaces to be painted */
 public Surface[] surfaceArray;

/**
 * Returns true if numGallons is enough to 
 * paint all surfaces in surfaceArray and
 * returns false otherwise
 * Preconditions: numGallons > 0
 * No elements of surfaceArray are null.
 * surfaceArray is not empty.
 * Postcondition: surfaceArray is unchanged.
 */
 public boolean hasEnoughPaint(int numGallons) 
 { /*to be implemented */ }
}

Write the  Painter  method  hasEnoughPaint.  The method should return  true  if  numGallons  gallons of paint is enough to paint all surfaces in  surfaceArray.  The method should return  false  otherwise. Each gallon of paint is enough to paint an area of 400 square feet.

For example, suppose  surfaceArray  has the following contents.

The array has 5 elements.

Each element has 2 attributes:

Length

Width

The following presents each element’s contents from left to right, beginning with element 0.

The elements in the array have the following contents:

Element 0:

Length: 15.0

Width: 5.0

Element 1:

Length: 7.0

Width: 10.5

Element 2:

Length: 12.0

Width: 10.0

Element 3:

Length: 20.0

Width: 20.0

Element 4:

Length: 4.0

Width: 11.5

In this example, the total area of all the surfaces in  surfaceArray  is 714.5 square feet.

The call  hasEnoughPaint(2)  should return  true  because 2 gallons is enough paint for up to 800 square feet.

The call  hasEnoughPaint(1)  should return  false  because 1 gallon is only enough paint for up to 400 square feet.
content.question:
Complete method  hasEnoughPaint.
 /**
 * Returns true if numGallons is enough to 
 * paint all surfaces in surfaceArray and
 * returns false otherwise
 * Preconditions: numGallons > 0
 * No elements of surfaceArray are null.
 * surfaceArray is not empty.
 * Postcondition: surfaceArray is unchanged.
 */
public boolean hasEnoughPaint(int numGallons)
